text: This place pretty wack. Came here after a really long morning to relax and get something to eat. I ordered the mother-shucker burger or whatever it's called. SPECIFICALLY said I wanted it well done and the whole thing was pink and disgusting. I didn't send it back, I just didn't wanna deal with it. But biting into it made me just feel so disgusted. Picture is taken when I brought it back in the leftover box. Also, the waiter was really really annoying. Like he wouldn't stop being nosy and asking us about the food like "are you going to want boxes later?" "Do you want dessert??" Chill bro
Do not ever go too crab corner...go only to shucks..best oysters for the money...incredible. ....omg and best service

If I could give this place negative stars I would, I have lived in Vegas for over a decade and never received service like this. Went in on June 14, 2017 @ 5:30 pm the male bartender on shift should be fired. He ignored me and my GF and attended to only regulars after ordering a beer, and not once asking for refills. After ordering dinner we didn't receive our order untill 45 min later (which was a salad, a wrap, a French fries) and in "to-go" bags when we never requested it. By that time a kind females bartender came on and asked him about us and our order seeing why it was "to-go" since we were at the bar where we ordered. The male bartender lied and said he never took our order. How a 50 year old bartender lies and acts like  a child is still beyond my belief. 
He did comp my beer because I gambled a little but his attitude and demeanor was atrocious and will be going on ever social media platform to complain about this experience. I have worked in customer service for years and don't expect red carpet service but to lie and be ignored for nothing is beyond my belief. I am more upset taking my time to write this but I could not bare this horrible service be unnoticed, I'd expect this from MC Donald's. Sorry but this place can go SHUCK itself.
Love this place. Great breakfast for $4.99. I always get the crescent breakfast sandwich which is delicious.
Cheap quality bar food at a high price.  Service is hit or miss.  Place is ugly.  Will suffice if you are in a late night munchie bind. 2.3 stars

We love this place for BREAKFAST of all things.  They have a great menu and the food and service are always impeccable.  By far one of the best sit-down breakfast spots in Vegas.  There's never a line, even on Sundays, most likely because it's still a best-kept secret.  When a friend told me what great breakfasts they served, I was shocked because it's definitely not the first place I would think of for Sunday breakfast.  Chicken fried steak and eggs for $4.99....simply awesome!!!

Well, I dine out tree to four times a week, this place is alright, quality of food is ok,  and so is the menu.  If you are looking for an enironment to hang out with friends this place will be ideal not for a quiet night out.  Place is clean, and the food quality is your tipical tavern food for the most part.  I ordered some Rockerfeller oysters they never arrived.

OMG... Ok. ... so if you love oysters this is definitely the place to eat at. I ordered 2 dozen Oysters. ..an order of garlic fries...that were so delicious they were to die for. If you like to drink... the bartender definitely hooks it up with a very generous amount of liquor...so this place hands down is a MUST eat at. Jackie and Ashley were awesome with the customer service which is rare in Vegas. I will definitely become a regular because of the great customer friendly service both the girls gave and the awesome taste of the fresh quality of the oysters. By the way they serve em up 24 hours and on Thursday oysters are $1 each ....yes... one dollar each oyster on thursdays.

I really enjoy getting seafood here and watching games at the bar.  I usually order off of their "special" menu that presents a better deal than just ordering off their regular menu.  Shimp and crab legs.  Fresh and delicious.

This place....good as fuck. 

Well hell, the shit is open 24 Hours and late night like past 2am there aren't any Vegas weirdos being weird. The bar tender is cooooooool and make drinks all tasty n shit. He also doesn't try to talk your goddamn head off like some places. The man does his job and does it with awesomeness and that's it. Seafood be good as fuck man, like shit where else can you have oysters, catfish, gumbo and shit at that hour? No where. Plus it's on a good side of town so get that ass up in there and get me a drink, I'll be on the way.

Truly, this place is our favorite everyday local eatery! 
A little background for a moment: I DO NOT eat fish. In fact, I hate fish. Closest thing I'll eat is popcorn shrimp lol. While I must say the popcorn shrimp is fantastic at Shucks, if I didn't want that or chicken tenders-which are also some of the best I've had- I found the rest of the menu (non fish items) to be mediocre. My husband on the other hand LOVES fish and crab, especially crab. He fell in love with the prices, quality, and large options available on the menu immediately while I was- sad to say- a harder sell. 

Recently they added new menu items and seem to have revamped the current menu as well with it and now I'm asking him to go to Shucks! I'm addicted to the chicken mac and cheese. It's always so fresh and tastey. And I also am very fond of the fried chicken sandwich and BBQ chicken salad. We can go out to eat quite often sometimes and with the recent new menu we're finding ourselves here pretty regularly. The staff is beginning to know us (can't imagine why! Lol) and we always get great service despite coming in at various times of the day and night. Sitting at the bar or dining room has never hindered service or quality for us. 

The atmosphere is a little dive-y but comfortable, casual, and not intimidating. I can't say much regarding their cocktails as we have only tried two: the Adios Shucker and Crab Walk. We always order one or both of those so you can say we like them a lot. 

PS- DESSERT TRAY. That is all.

Place is a bar with seating on the side, typical dinner tables and booths. Seafood was definitely frozen, not fresh, but prepared fine. Lots of specials, cheap drafts, if you go mid week when its not busy it is a pleasant enough atmosphere. Service was on par, its also a bar so expect a waitress who is doing multiple things at once.
Gf loved her shrimp pasta.
Probably wouldn't return, try someplace better next time

I stumbled upon this location while searching for a late night restaurant for my after wedding dinner for 30 people! From the initial phone call they were so very accommodating, I was actually skeptical because they were so nice!! Everything was AMAZING - from the service to the food! This is definitely a place we will be frequenting, all of my guests were surprised at the quality of the food for the price. Thank you Shucks for making my special night that much better!

This is the best late place I've been to for food in Vegas. My wife and I had just left The Ainsworth Lounge at Hard Rock Hotel and we were very hungry and it was around 1am. My wife and I really had a taste for some sushi but any kind of seafood would do. We started yelping trying to find the closest place to our home and low and behold Shucks had great reviews the only problem was that they didn't sell Sushi, we figured lets try it anyways because oysters would suffice.

We arrive at Shucks park there were more than 8 cars in the parking lot and they had a two sets of double doors. We'd walked through the first set of doors and found that we had to ring a doorbell to get into this establishment. That was a bummer because after ringing the doorbell and waiting literally waiting about a minute I told my wife lets go, I can be very impatient and I thought that at the Sedona the kitchen was open 24hrs but to my surprise it wasn't. After arriving at the Sedona finding out that the kitchen is no longer 24hrs the bartender at the Sedona suggested that we go back to Shucks. We gladly took his advice and returned. 

Arriving back at Shucks we rang the doorbell and we were in less than 10 seconds.
My new favorite restaurant! Been here 3 times in the last two weeks and then never let us down will keep coming back! Fast service and delicious food at a great price!

Ive been here twice in the last 3 weeks and ordered catfish both times.  Love the cornmeal crust.  Light and crispy and perfectly seasoned.  Fries are solid, just not a lot of them and I didnt try the coleslaw.  Service was attentive and friendly.  I'll be back for more catfish!

Been going here for the past year and it's always been a great time. I'm in the industry so I only show up on the graveyard shift. Larry is always attentive and offers great recomendations. Im a fan of his and the bar for sure!
I love this place! Crab anytime of the day for a good price. They're menu items are delicious and drinks are pretty good. I go here more than anywhere else!

Worst customer service ever. I been to this place a few tines and have always been treated like crap. Last night was it for me. The bartender/waiter was rude and cursing at us from across the way because we asked for hot butter. Dont know why a place wld want to turn away money. When we have done nothing wrong. And was completely ignored the whole time. He checked on everyone around us and just walked past us like we were not there at all from the moment we walked in the door.

Super high quality shellfish.  The oysters were fantastic, cold peel and eat shrimp was perfect (including the temp, not too cold), and the bacon wrapped shrimp with a glaze was out of this world.  The food comes out fast so order in waves so you have time to enjoy your cold beer!
Great place for late night food. It's to only place in the area for good seafood & drinks after work. Larry the graveyard bartender makes us feel welcome we will be back again for sure.

We started of with the $5 apps. The crab dip was good  decent amount of crab flavor and creamy, the clam strips were bigger then the stuff you get at long john silver, and the calamari was solid.  The oyster po boy was alright about  4 oysters in a hoagie roll , lettuce ,tom and tartar sauce no wow factor just alright. I would come back prices reasonable.

This is my second time coming here and both times have been great service. I'll keep it simple and only do this time's review. 

You seat yourself. And it is a bit dark here. (I like coming for breakfast though so its kinda funky being dark) 

Our waiter was the same both times. Super tall nice guy. 

He let us order breakfast (it was ending in ten minutes I believe)

He's very nice. My other half ordered steak and eggs. Our waiter asked how he would like it cooked and he said "scrambled" (not realizing he meant the steak) we all laughed. He's got a good sense of humor. Not afraid to joke. 


And the food is great and cheap! Two people we paid like $16 for two breakfasts! Yesterday at cracked egg (which I love) we paid $40

This place is fantastic! I frequent this spot because I LOVE seafood, and it's a cool little place to unwind after a long day. I always bring a friend or two, sit at the bar, have some beer/ wine and order a bunch of oysters 

The great thing is that they also have a bunch of delicious crab, lobster, mussels, shrimp, etc. Yay! I always get to try something new when I'm here.

My fiancé and I love this place along with most of our family... peel and eat shrimp are awesome ...let alone the price ...we love to come for there breakfast when we are too lazy to cook... brought my niece for breakfast for her b day n she loved it !! We also love the fact that it's smoke free and kid friendly as a mater of fact me and my fiancé are heading there for dinner once she's off work :)
Great menu and delicious food. Nice atmosphere. We like coming here for a relaxing meal. my wife LOVES the coconut shrimp, I love the fresh fish choices. All the food comes hot and tasty.
This place used to be good. Now quality is horrible. Let's go. Step it up. Went there excited left there disappointed. 1 star

Went there with friends for lunch. Two of us ordered coconut shrimp. When it came the coconut was burned. It was a big disappoint. The others were not that happy with their food either. Shucks has been removed as a lunch spot for us.

This is my go-to spot for cheap, convenient shellfish.  I'd highly recommend one of the enormous clambakes that comes with snow and dungeness crab, corn, potatoes, and clams which are served in an embarassingly huge clam shell bowl.  Before going, make sure you print  coupons off their website for $5 off the clambake or 6 free oysters (if you spend $20).  

I'm also a fan because they're not stingy with the whiskey.  Their drink prices may be higher than some other nearby spots, but you can get some stroonnng drinks.

Beware: If you hate the Cowboys, this place is not for you.

Nickolas was our server when we sat in the bar area a few nights ago! He was great! The food was good too, and very reasonably priced. Got a huge bowl of clam chowder for $3.99 and my friend got two giant glasses of vodka press for $10!! Can't beat that really!! The garbage salad with dill dressing was the bomb and clams in white wine sauce was super good too. Didn't care much for the tuna tartare but oh well everything else was great!!

Went for the oysters--- weren't looking for a special---- they were great! 18 bucks for a dozen--- 
Sever cold l, good flavor, spicy horseradish! Will definitely return---- 
Bacon wrapped shrimp was so-so-- kinda chewy-- but now horrible-- probly won't get that next time--- but the oysters made up for it!

My favorite breakfast place in Las Vegas hands down. The service is consistent and friendly, the food is very reasonably priced, and the portions are neither overwhelming or leaving you wanting. We have breakfast at Shuck's 2-3 times a week and we LOVE it. It's the best way to start your day.

This is hands down the most underrated breakfast spot in town. I'm a regular customer and would highly recommend Shucks for breakfast. You can literally have a great meal for $5. Service is always good and quick which makes it even better.

I was a bit disappointed last Thursday night with my visit.  I hadnt been here for 4 years, use to come about 1 time a month late night.  Always quite but the food was a bit pricy for the quality.  I always ordered a steak - not a seafood lover like my ex.  Lately they have had a full lot quite a bit and thought why not try it again.  Really geared for sports and gaming with less expensive food gimics to bring you in.  Not impressed.  Service had gone down and clientle too.  Not anywhere to bring the family.   If you like gambling and sports its the place to go.  Shell fish my friend said is worth the price but not the drive.

Came here after an evening of ice skating. It was a Friday night and still relatively quiet. The place is pretty cute (themed) and the bar area is roomy so I imagine there would still be a good amount of space even if it had been crowded. My friend and I had gotten a coupon off the restaurant's site ($27.95 for dinner for two). The food was pretty good; however, our server was kind of a jerk (making sarcastic comments and being condescending). He was also a bit slow and forgetful even though there were only a handful of full tables and a few other servers working. So even with a good dinner, the uncomfortable service is making me question if I'd go back.

Everyone who comes here gets crabs!

Shuck's Tavern II on Flamingo is the perfect place to go for delicious crab legs and seafood.  The portions are generous, the service is quick, and the prices are very reasonable.  

I would give this place 5 stars if it were only a seafood restaurant, but it is not.  There are many other options on the menu, and most are forgettable.  The Chicken Caesar wrap was awful, and should not be ordered.  The wrap was soggy with a bland dressing, and chewy chicken. 

You wouldn't go to a pizza place and order a filet would you?  Stick to the delicious ocean fare at this tavern, and a few cold beers, and you can't go wrong.

This is a Dallas Cowboys bar, you have been warned.
Great place, good Oysters, and calamari, the lobster roll is decent, but the seafood louie salad dressing is awesome.

only gets one star because service was horrible. Food is fairly good. I walked in with my husband and sat at the bar. We were there for late night and we were asked by the guy bartender to move to the corner if we weren't drinking. I wanted to leave right away like who does that? Then he sat 2 girls in our spot and they didnt even have a drink!! none the less he completely ignored us and I swore I would not return to this place

What a Big Disappointment today My husband and went to Shucks for lunch and we haven't been there for awhile I ordered a spicy Maria and for 9.00 give me a break. it wasn't anything special No celery like it was advertised three olives though and it wasn't spicy. My husband had gumbo it looked like gravy other than gumbo He did get two small crab legs and only two shrimp it was so soupy and it was bland and for him to put Tabasco I knew it wasn't good What a Bad lunch.

This is just up the street where I live!  Went  to Thursday $1.00 Oysters and had 2 dozens!!!  What a great price, 2 dz for $24.00!  It was good oysters (not great but for the price you are paying for, it's a great deal!) and decided to order appetizer (the mussels) which was good and a great amount!  I ordered the 1/2lb Dungess crab and it was not lacking any meat and for the price of $8.95 for half pound, I think it's a great deal!  It's a lot less expensive then Joe's Crab Shack and it was gooooddddd!

Overall I will definitely go back as a regular.  It was very slow on a Thursday, given it was $1.00 Oyster night but I don't mind it not being bust because our food came out in a timely manner!  This will replace Joe's Crab Shack!  Price was great and food was good!
No smoking. Yes gaming. No douchey signs about gaming to sit at the bar!  Crab legs? Oh, boy! I might have found the perfect bar.
1 of my Favorite spots to grab dinner after work - Great daily specials as well as Happy Hour deals & a Very friendly staff on Any nite of the week

My 2nd favorite Shuck's.  Although, I like the feel of the Centennial location better, the crowd on Flamingo is a little more diverse.  You never know if there's a party, sports league, rowdy bunch, or whatever else makes for good people watching.

Still great fresh seafood and cold beers.  Gotta love locals joints!

This is the 2nd Shucks I've been to. The first one is the one located in Centennial area & I've had their breakfast croissant sandwich before which is my favorite!!! YUMMY! This location I went to, to meet a friend. I found that there are a lot of senior citizens that hang out @ this place. They chose to sit @ the bar drinking, gambling & eating dinner. Probably not a place for young people to hang out at. Bartenders were nice. Could have been a little more efficient of keeping the drinks filled & plates cleared away. It wasn't really that busy when I was there. Dinning area was dead, seems the bar area is the place to hang out. Ran into two weirdos while there. One guy who seemed to be a frequent flyer who appeared hyper on meth. & another odd old man asking for my permission & another lady's permission to sit at the bar...really? Odd.... I won a little money on the video poker machine but gave back my winnings....lol My sandwich was tasty.
Good Food, Good Drinks, Great Service!  It's not always easy to find a gaming bar that is smoke free - this is a great neighborhood spot where you won't leave smelling like smoke.

Went there last night to bring home a seafood bucket.... Had crab legs, Mussels and Shrimp.... Crab legs were of the smaller variety but really very tasty as were the Mussels and Shrimp... Good neighborhood place to go!

Love this place!

It's a little over a mile from our house so when I feel like hanging out, getting some late night snackin and some beer, this is always my first choice. 

Their prices are cheap.
The oysters are fresh.

I have even gone to Big Al's at the Orleans and I was served with foamy oysters. Eww!

I came in at 1am with my husband and there was no wait. We ordered 1 dozen oysters, a half pound of crab legs, an oyster shooter, and stuffed shrimp. Everything was delicious! I was really surprised lol I read some bad reviews and was soooo worried but we had a great experience. Our server and bartender had a great attitude and was super nice. I will definitely be back  we paid $44 for everything not including tip. What a great price!

Got what we ordered, food was prepared correctly and delivered promptly. Nice to go somewhere with good food and good service. Oysters shooters are pretty good, really good. I ordered the Shucks Shooter, comes with a shot oh vodka.

Ever since we moved to Las Vegas, I have been meaning to try this place. We finally took the plunge and went in on a weeknight for some oysters and seafood. The place was packed which is always a good sign. 

They have a great menu selection and it was difficult to decide what to order. There were a number of options that I wanted to try. I settled on 6 oysters to start and was told that they were from Louisiana. I love oysters, but had never had any from Louisiana so my interests were peaked. They arrived and they were meaty and large. However, the taste was underwhelming. The last few almost tasted badly. Not sure if my taste-buds are just adverse for Lousiana oysters or if the quality was not there (the oysters were on special that night), either way, I will not be ordering next time I go back which is disapointing for an oyster bar. I wish they had a better selection for oysters.

I got a salad with crab meat, shrimp, and ahi tuna. The salad was great! The dressing was tasty and the quality of seafood was delicious. My husband ordered the salmon and he was pleased with his meal, as well.

Customer service could use some improvement. Everyone was friendly, but they were slow with greating us and getting us the check. I noticed other customers were frustrated with the slow service, as well. We will definitely be back and my review may go up depending on how the customer service is the next time we go to this spot.
This place is awesome. With friends or solo mission it's the place to be. Nice, clean and friendly environment. The food makes this cheat day worth every last calorie. Check them out .

Came to happy hour with all of our family and I wasnt very impressed , the 3.00 margaritas were disgusting. The service was super slow. Im pretty sure my sister in laws mom got sick from eating the oysters there. She tried one and sent it back but was sick the rest of the evening. She told the waiter she could tell they werent fresh. I had the ceviche it was ok but nothing special. I definitely will not be recommending this restaurant in the future.

We've been here a couple of times and really like the food. We took my husband's parents here Thursday night Jan. 23 2014 and the service was just AWFUL.! Despite there being several bartenders (we sat at the bar) we had to ask each time we wanted another drink as our glasses sat there empty. We ordered a dozen oysters on the half shell to split and when the guy brought them out and asked who wanted them we told them we were splitting them. His response was "how are we going to do this?" Seriously?!? Give us another plate dude! I hate telling people how to do their own job. We were left without napkins and had to get up to get our own from other tables more than once. Then we were charged for our Father's drink because he only bet $20 in the machine. 

The food was good (even though I ate a couple oysters without crackers because it took a long time to get the bartender's attention to ask for them.) The crab cakes were previously frozen so not so good. I'm giving more than one star because the food was pretty good but overall we were pretty shocks at how incompetent and bad the service was.

Shucks was the pick of a particular day about a week ago, with promises of a $3.95 breakfast after a good morning of training.  While en route, my buddy placed a call while on the move  to confirm the ever so tempting price of a less then $5.00 dollar breakfast.  The phone call confirmed that it was a dollar more BUT still under a finski.  Upon arrival, ST&OB was found to be very mellow at eleven something in the morning.  FYI...The breakfast special runs until 1:00PM.  I ordered up a chicken fried steak, with two eggs (over medium) served with home fries (wanted/ordered cheese, didn't get) with sourdough toast.  The food came out pipping hot  and tasted like a $8.00 breakfast.....Hell, it tasted like a $12.00 breakfast.  The service was friendly and the establishment was clean.  Absolutely an opton to vist again if in the area.

Fridays is the best day to come here- they offer daily specials, but Friday's choices are by far the best value. You can pick orders of crawfish, mussels, crab cocktail, or crab & spinach dip for a flat $5 each. And did I mention martinis are half off ($10 each down to $5)? And they don't halve the portions for the specials, we're talking gigantic, full orders, for minimal money.

CRAB COCKTAIL: It's crab, the portion isn't huge but it's fresh and tasty, and you can't beat $5 (regularly ~$10?). Order one per person, or whoever gets their hands on it first is going to eat the whole thing.
MUSSELS: Large portion, white wine sauce. Not the best sauce, but again, you can't beat the value for the price/portion. Easily a meal for one, and sided with a piece of their addictively-good garlic cheese bread.
CRAWFISH: Available depending on the season, also sided with the bread. Not nearly as good as other places in town, though it isn't the easiest dish to find in the first place. Wouldn't get again, but it's not necessarily bad.
MARTINITS: The "dirty shucker" is a classic dirty martini, done well but the Chocolate Salted Pretzel is the stuff of legends. See Lisa H's review for more coverage, but it's something you have to try at least once. Fridays, for $5, is the best night to do so.

Service was friendly, and the bar is lined with TVs, making it a good spot to watch the game. Draft domestics were ~$4 while bottled specialty beers were about $5. In addition to all this money-saving awesomeness, Shucks is open 24/7!

Best champagne oyster shooters I've had. Karina at the bar was awesome! Service, drinks, and food were all great plus hey had our soccers games on! In a great location and easy access from the freeway.

I give them 2 stars for the great service and hospitality of the bartenders and servers, ON THE OTHER HAND THE FOOD it's mediocre whith no flavor what so ever . Ceviche was decent everything else insipid.

My boyfriend and I came here around 1 a.m. on a Thursday (Vegas hours, totally normal) to quench his newfound appetite for oysters. A quick search on Yelp brought us to Shucks just in time for the Thursday special - $1 oysters. They also had a late night menu available, with typical bar fare (burgers, wings, calamari, chicken strips) for about $5. We ordered a dozen oysters to share, and he had a half pound of peel and eat shrimp. As far as the oysters, I suppose you get what you pay for. Granted... it's July, we're smack dab in the middle of a desert, and they were a dollar; but these definitely weren't the freshest oysters I've ever had. Boyf mowed through his shrimp pretty quickly and seemed satisfied. 

This place is kind of a cross between a dive bar and a generic Applebee's-esque chain. It was open, clean, and not at all smoky; a big plus in my book. The bartender was prompt and to the point, but didn't go out of his way to make small talk. They had a great double IPA from Utah on tap, and he was nice enough to comp our drinks even though I was only sporadically playing 25 cent hands of video blackjack. 

Bottom line: for the price, it was decent, but I'll take Boiling Crab or Hot N Juicy any day.

Nothing screams great place to hang out more than good food, good beer and good friends. 

Since I'm somewhat new to town, I joined a Kickball league. Yeah, laugh all you want, but every week I get to hang out with cool people and play a "sport"....but afterwards, we all come to Shucks. 

The drink prices are very reasonable, the food is solid. Try the Cuban wrap. Fricking amazing. 

The servers are really great. I recommend Ashley. She is the coolest. 

Also , this is a BIG Cowboys bar, so if you actually like that team, come here and hang out. I'm a Jets fan, but who cares. I like a good time, and I know I can find it here. 

P.S. The booths are very comfortable. The bathrooms are clean. And again, try the Cuban Wrap.

Generous portion...Seared ahi- tdf!!  Seafood bisque awesome too. Love this place.last time I had crab Louie salad, also awesome. Went here for st. Patricks and it was hoppin!!! Today, around 2pm not busy, a good time to drop in and check it out

UPDATE:
Met some friends here for drinks and the drinks/food were great and the server was super nice! We gambled and guess what.. he comped a few of our drinks! Isn't that how it should be?! Thanks Brooks! 


LAST REVIEW:
Came here last night w a friend.  Ordered the "create your own" with 4!items.. got the calamari which was not good. No flavor and some pieces had undercooked breading on them. The oysters (he said were great! I don't eat them), coconut shrimp and ceviche that we both loved! Also got a bowl of poke to share (which was sooooo good! He got a French connection (courvoisier and grand marnier) and an energy drink. I got a michelada (good flavor) and a ginger ale. 
We Both lost $20 in the machine.. and didn't even get my soda comped.. hmmm. That's unheard of.
5 stars for the food. 
2 stars for the service. Although he was pleasant to us (minus not comping anything) the way he talked to some of the customers wasn't nice. "You need menus?" "Then come get em"

This is one of my favorite spots to come late at night, after work, for great food. Their oysters are amazing and I usually get those,  but this time I had their crab legs and you can't go wrong either way! My friend had one of the best burgers I've ever had, it had blue cheese on it, I forgot the name of it. Affordable drinks and great food at all hours, what more can you ask for!?

We ordered a side of crab legs and I ordered a steak.  The waiter brought me steak and crab legs.  When I told him I only ordered the steak because we had gotten the crab legs on the side he said okay and grabbed the crab legs off my plate.  Is it just me or was that a little weird.  I have been plenty of other places that have said oh okay well just go ahead and have them but I will take them off your ticket.  I have never had anyone just reach over and take food off my plate that was not related to me or dating me.  And on top of it all not very good food.  Will not be going back.

I met with my trainer at Fitlabs down the street on Friday.  He told me I should eat oysters once a week.  I drove directly from the gym to Shucks Tavern and Oyster Bar to remedy the situation immediately.

I had the barbecued oysters.  They were good and served so hot the shells were kind of burning my fingers.  I loved the oysters but I thought I'd like to see a little less sauce so you can taste the oyster.  Next time I will try the regular oysters and compare.  Very good.  I am going to target Thursdays for the Oysters.

Fridays they have a happy hour and so I ordered fried calamari and some fries and some iced tea.  My bill with tip was right at $20.  

It was good food but it would be a lot more fun with the friends in tow!

So I come into this place all the time. The bartenders are usually amazing but IVE had two bad experiences in a row now. Last night we stopped in late to grab a few drinks and some food. Sat around for 10 minutes before the rude bartender came over with her mouth full of food to ask what we wanted. 
The food was decent as usual but the bartender never refilled our cocktails and never even came back to see how the food was.
Then this morning, I was craving some breakfast and a Bloody Mary so I sat at the bar per usual and waited 15 minutes then left. The bartender never even came out... 
Really turned me off to this place!

Great seafood. Love their fried oysters. Great food choices, casual, eat at the bar if you want. Classic rock plays, come as you are. Food served in paper lined baskets. Everything I've ever ordered was delicious. Sports on all the tv's, video poker machines at the bar. Casual ambiance, friendly staff.

I like this spot. It's real chill and reasonably priced. I've been on 2 occasions and I'm sure I'll be back. If I had to say something I don't like about this place is it would be so much better if they offered a happy hour on drinks instead of just on the gaming then it would certainly be one of my go to hang-outs. Still good spot however.

I am really a fan of Shucks!
Came here on random occasions for some time and always enjoyed the food. 
Recently, I had some friends in town and after one breakfast at Shucks, they made it their home base. This years, I have been there 5 times for a meal and some drinks. Now, on a first name basis with several servers, my gf and I are trying every sandwich and breakfast item. If you a fan of Fries, you are in luck, they are among the best!! Waffle and regular!!

Check it out, it's a good join, neat specials and very, very awesome staff!!
(I don't work there, but I would)

Went to try this place with my husband. First off the air conditioner was out on a 110 degree day. Not really their fault. But their bartender was serving drinks to everyone and never even offered water. I had to ask. We were gambling and ordered drinks. Had to pay for them. Unusual in Vegas but ok. What wasn't ok was the shots we ordered and waited 10 minutes for only to get water with a drop of liquor. This place cost way too much for the horrible service we received. Not going back.
Fresh seafood,,Tasty food,,Great Bloody Marys...Good prices...Clean place

Although I've only checked in twice,  the boyfriend and I have dined here a few more times than that,  and we've never been disappointed.  We're always aware that during certain time of the year, certain seafood will not be in season. 

Friday's special: 1/2 price Martinis and $5 appetizers (crab cocktail,  crab spinach dip,  mussels,  calamari, & crawfish)

Tonight, the linings of my stomach was calling for seafood and beer, and Shucks had both! Once we arrived, there was a bit of a crowd, but it seemed everyone was enjoying their food that the noise level was amazingly low. 

We sat ourselves,  and our server,  Ash, immediately greeted us and started with our drinks.  She was super sweet and attentive!  I was craving everything on the menu that Ash let me order one thing at a time and was quick with the service!  Loved her for it! 

So we ended the night with two beers, two $5 specials (mussels and crab spinach dip),  Texas oysters (not spicy at all), and 1/2 lb snow crabs legs (not fully in season).  The mussels was Ahh-mazing! I wish the crab spinach dip came with more crab :/ and the Texas oysters was suppose to be topped with lemon,  tequila, and tabasco ... I didn't taste any of it :/ Shouldve just gone with the 1/2 dozen of oysters and asked for extra lemon and Tabasco. At least the will be a next time! :D

I really don't get some of the low ratings that other users have posted. If you're looking for good quality Pub Food (Burgers, Sandwiches, Breakfasts, etc) served 24 hours a day, Shucks is Awesome. I haven't tried out their crab and oyster special nights but I've heard from friends they are pretty decent value.  I mostly go on the graveyard shift and they have some ridiculously low priced specials on Graveyard. Big Burger and Fries for $4, Omelets $4, and quite a few other options. The food is consistently good and high quality. The graveyard bartender ( I think his name is Larry) is super friendly, always has a menu ready for me, knows what I like to drink, and remembers my name and what I had eaten the time before even though it's sometimes a month or so between visits.

In Summary, Shucks is on my short list of places to stop for food late at night when I want something decent, I don't want to pay an arm and a leg, and just want to get in and out in a reasonable amount of time.

Jason
their breakfast rocks , cant beat the price , dont let the secret out !
I really like this place. so calm with delicious dishes!

The New England Chowder was not too thick but deliciously flavored, so was the crab spinach dip w super thin tortillas, and the oyster PO boys were good too...albeit, more oysters wouldn't have hurt:)  my new favorite place!

I was served a cold $8.95 seafood Benedict and it was served 10 minutes after my family's meals. When I spoke to the server and then manager, they were extremely disrespectful and defensive. I've been coming here for years and have never had such a terrible experience. How sad.

Went here on a Friday night. A bowl pf peel n eat shrimp was $5. Not bad. Good service, but the food was ok. Oysters were fresh but really small. The appetizer we ordered, spinach artichoke dip, was weirdly colored blue almost. The chips it came with tasted a bit burnt. The drinks we ordered weren't bad, but they weren't good either. Overall, we will come here for the small but fresh oysters. But most likely that would be it.

Shucks to me, as a Stand alone restaurant is one of the very few left in this great city of Las Vegas with quality and standards above the rest. 
Always amazing service and food.
The quality of food to price ratio is crazy. Really inexpensive for what you get.
I rather eat here than most places on the strip.
I'm very lucky too,that I live close to this spot..
Don't think of it as just gaming bar food . (Won't mention any names)If you just come for the food you won't be Disappointed.  
Specially the great sandwiches and burgers. 
Ohh...and keep your eye on the great specials on the door as you enter.
Generous big plate with huge coconut shrimp is so worth it! I love Fresh crab meat Louie salad with toast. SoooOoo good. All the food is so good. Oysters so fresh too!

The food is great but I agree with the rest of these reviews, the service is awful. I got scallops which were great, but the service was not there, at all. If I go back I'll be sure to avoid the older filipino woman!

Food was great,service was horrible! My fiancé and I went during a very slow. It was only us and one other table in there so there's no excuse for the way the service was I had to get up three times to ask for our check! The food was delicious just wish they would hire better servers!

I was kind of nervous about going to this place, but I love seafood. I had read a lot of bad reviews about the service. I was pleasantly surprised. It was seat yourself, but there was someone there right away to ask for a drink order. We were only there for a quick lunch, so it was just sodas. Good to know that they have $3 margaritas.  We just ordered the crab cake stuffed shrimp and the clam strips, a cup of clam chowder and a cup of seafood bisque.

The clam chowder was really good, being from MA, I'm kind of picky. My husband really liked the seafood bisque, not what I think of bisque, but tasty and had some seafood in it. The crab cake stuffed shrimp were kind of tiny, but the taste was good, and the clam strips were more like real clams than I have seen anywhere else on the west side of the country.

Overall, it was all really good. Anthony, our server, was excellent. I even knocked over my whole diet coke and didn't get an attitude. I will definitely go back!

We went there for my dad's birthday (11 people) and it was the worst seafood we have ever had. It tasted like everything was previously frozen!

The calamari was overcooked, too chewy, the shrimp were slimy and smelly, and the crabcakes taste like they were previously frozen. The clams were overcooked and were sent back. 
The service was good but the food was terrible.

5 Stars! Not cause its a super duper fine dining place... but because it was great in food and experience. Yeah sure it's nothing to go Ape over, but I got everything I expected from this kind of place. Had some oyster shooters. Yum. Louisiana oysters... YUM YUM.

One thing I DO have to say is, they had the BEST snow crab I've ever had. The texture was good. Not mushy or cakey. Not super salty or watered down like the stuff you might find at buffets. And it had an awesome sweetness to it. I enjoyed it more than the lobster. And I love lobster over crab!

Great food. Check.
Good drinks... check...
...totally worth what you pay for.

I left the place like a fatty.

If you don't want crawfish but have a seafood craving.. go here.

It might not satisfy everyone... but this place now tops Hot & Juicy and Boiling Crab for me!

Way back in the days when use to play my adult rec hockey games at the Las Vegas Ice Center over ten years ago or more.. Shucks was one of the team drinking spots after the games since literally right across the street. I only have found memories of the place. The beers reasonable price, laid back atmosphere, lots of televisions all around the bar area and dining area, and nice little diversity of food not just normal bar food. Since no longer play at the Las Vegas Ice Center not often drive around that area. Talk about bringing the throwback on St Patty Day. 

St Patty Day went out with my roommates for some drinks and food. We tried to do traditional Irish bar but really if looking for laid back atmosphere not the best idea. Shucks was close by our second miss. It wound up being ideal spot get our celebration on. The place was not crowded but few people in the spirit with full on green outfits and partying. Not crazy that we could have conversation without yelling at one another. 

Guess Friday they have this "FIVE for $5" from 8am-midnight on appetizers. So we got the calamari and crab & spinach dip start. The calamari was solid nothing that blow you away. It had nice breading, great seasoning, nice portion size (usually see specials make it smaller but our waiter told us normal size portion), and both dipping sauces was great. The crab and spinach was just ok for me. I could have done without. It great deal because we ordered two of the five items. 

My entree I ordered the oyster po boy. It was solid. The bread was on point. Nice crusty on the outside. The oysters they use nice size ones not huge or small. Just right cause last thing want small ones all dried out or big ones moist in the middle. The dressing along with the lettuce, tomato, and am sure missing couple other items. It all came together really nice. If looking for solid sandwich the po boy great choice.
Great price for the breakfast deal $4.99 chicken steak & eggs, friendly staff good food and price. Music is little loud. But it is a bar, what can you say right ??
Wow seafood is great !oysters specials on thursday wonderfull .service was great found my new home!

We have been coming here for years.  The food is delicious and reasonable, the atmosphere is relaxed, the service is above attentive and most importantly, it's a great family environmental including with small children. We went for breakfast AND dinner the recent thanksgiving as we were looking to maximize kid time.  There is a terrific kid menu and the portions for the whole menu are ample. The $5.00 appetizer menu is awesome.  Service always fast and cordial/warm, we have bought many friends along and they are grateful for the intro.  Its our regular place!  thanks to Victor and all the wonderful staff!

Eh, not sure if I like this place or not. 

Thursday oysters for 1.50 were good. Large and cold. Too much cocktail sauce served with them. The other specials looked enticing but questionable. 

My drink was weak and pricy. 

No smoking in it. Bar or restaurant? Confusing.

Customer service was just ok. I like my bartenders  with a smile.. A little flirty too.
I liked the ambience of this place. It was very casual, but the food was terrible. I really dislike writing negative reviews, but this is a place I will never eat at again.

Feel duped by suspicious raving reviews.   Oysters were ok, prefer colder.  Atmosphere makes chili's or outback seem glamorous.  Service was mediocre at best.  Worst part was coincidently the most important, the food.  My wife ordered a bucket that cost around $20 and consisted of 9 counted shrimp and 12 clams that were drowned in butter and water.  I ordered a $25 dollar seafood platter that had seafood that rivaled long John silver's complete with store bought crab cakes.  Same price or more expensive than way better local joints with better seafood in town.  Other reviews must be friends of the owners.  For price, quality, and ambiance, giving two stars is fair, if not generous.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! The food is great. The specials are wonderful. Haven't tried their drinks yet besides beer. Service is pretty good as well. This is going to become my new favorite spot.

Thursdays = $1 oysters! Other specials I remember:

Tuesdays = $3 tacos (the mahi mahi is the best! Chicken and steak was good as well)

Sundays = 1/2 off wine bottles

Those are the days I have gone so far. Ordered the clam bake on thursday and it was a decent portion. Flavor of it was great (picture posted) Also they have a burger special BOGO FREE with fries and $2 for draft - the burger was cooked perfectly with bacon, mushrooms, and cheese. Also had raw oysters and rockafeller (a bit small, but good flavor). Calamari was yummy. Shrimp ceviche was PHENOMENAL!

Reason for missing the 5th star.. well, parking was small and food takes a little while.

Good quality Snow Crab Legs are hard to find outside of a Vegas buffet, and the ones on the buffets are usually knackered with pre-scored cuts to make eating 'easier' but take the fun out of cracking and pickin' the crab, which is half the fun IMO. I've been in the hunt for a non-buffet Snow Crab spot. Not even Costco sells Snow Crab (at least 11.5 months out of the year...)

Have eaten at Shucks twice in the past week, the first time I ordered a pound ($17.90/pound) of Snow Crab, it came out Grade A quality: color, size and taste. Impressive! Pressed my luck a few days later and was served a Grade B quality crab :( Still better than the crab available at the neighborhood Smiths/Kroger/Albertsons (Grade C: $6.99/pound) but disappointing that the 2nd visit wasn't consistent with the first. Also, the side of roasted red potatoes on the 2nd visit were slightly under-roasted. Just substitute for their Burger-King-style, twice-fried fries instead, and you'll be OK: these are delicious.

Love that Shucks is open 24 hours and non-smoking. A direct view of the televisions is a slight challenge from some of the seating areas, so get there early before the big game. Half-price draft beers on certain NFL nights is a solid deal ($2-$3 per pint).

I will never go here again! The worst oyster Rockefeller ever! And I only went to order to go and it was as if I was an inconvenience! And the soup was a thick paste no way a bisque! I wasted my $40 for real

My girlfriend and my son and myself eat here about twice a month. We have tried several different things on the menu from Sandwiches to pasta to fish and seafood. The portions are good, and the food is always hot and fresh. The prices are very reasonable and your service will be prompt and friendly. If you have not eaten here you are missing out on the jewel of Flamingo Road.

Oh my Gosh! This place was so good! Oyster Rockefeller, Clam chowder, clam linguini, and now the the apple pie with a scoop of ice cream, all was sooo good! Definitely worth a 2nd or even a 3rd trip to come here. Pretty close to the house so that's good cause the Cucumber 'Chelda' is doing a number now. But was all so worth the price.

I really enjoyed this place until I found 4 hairs in my food...
The first couple times that I ate here, the food was really good and I was very impressed.  Then on the 3rd visit I ordered the fried shrimp basket to go and while eating I noticed not 1, but 4 black hairs in my food and one was even wrapped around the shrimp.  So I called the restaurant the next day to speak with a manager and left a detailed message as to what happened, and wouldn't you know... I never got a return call.  So its safe to say that this joint is officially off the list.

Great seafood! Great service! Good beer!
I love their Friday happy hour menu! $5 mussels! Can't beat that!!!! Also they have other happy hour menus for different days of the week. 
I do not recommend their lobster roll or cioppino. Too thick of a soup base. BUT everything else has been great! Even their steaks! 
The servers are always very knowledgable and friendly. Just don't expect exceptional service if their busy, just like any other busy place!!! Have patience when their busy and you will have a great experience. The highlight of all my dining experiences always comes down to the food! And their food is yummy!!!!!!!!!!
Oh and their oysters are fresh and delish!!!!!!!!!
I love this place right next to my house and everyday they have a special !!!! Oysters crab legs whatever you're in the mood for this is the place to be very chill great environment super clean
I love this place all the food is soo good and they have good prices and is a nice place to go with the family and friends
I'd rate this place as decent.  Not great but not to bad.  The service was good but the quality of the food left me with more to desire.
Excellent Sevice, Delicious Food, cozy atmosphere and reasonable prices!:)AW
This place used to be a go-to for late night food n drink, but dang, its slipped bigtime. Always dead, and bartender won't even honor their past daily specials anymore.  Not worth going to!!!

Disgusting. Food and service was bad. Oysters were strange and not cold at all. A pitcher of beer here costs more than a dozen of their crappy oysters. I also found a dead fly in my beer cup which I should have taken a picture of as proof.

No Smoking anywhere! Love love love it. They offer $2 drafts on Monday and Wednesday and a different daily dining special all week. This location is also a Dallas Cowboys bar so they offer food and drink specials during all the games. Some of the specials include $8 pitchers, $5 Texas teas and $1 oysters. They offer a lot more food specials during the games and a Bloody Mary bar starting at $6 for the 10am games. You might want to get there a little early for good seats. In my experience, it doesn't fill up but the seats in the bar area around the tv's are always scooped up pretty quick. There are a few tv's in the dining area as well but the view is not as good.

The service is average and the food is a little better than typical tavern fare. I recommend the Crab Stuffed Tilapia with vegetables and wild rice. It's a pretty tasty entree for around $15. And did I mention that there is no smoking, even in the bar?

Decent place, I don't know what all the bad reviews are for. Service was good. Food was good. We ordered seafood jambalaya which you can get with either rice or pasta, we ordered it with pasta. It was a huge amount. And tasted fine not great but fine. Also ordered Dungeness crab, fried oysters with a side of garlic fries, very good. The oysters came with a nice size helping of coleslaw, I'm not a huge fan of coleslaw but I tasted it and it was good. Crab legs came with red potatoes. All good.

We came here at 2am after a night on the town because this place is 24 hours, but we would have been better off at IHOP or Denny's.  The overnight worker there was incredibly testy and rude.  We did nothing to provoke him other than walk through the door.  I mean I get it if he doesn't like working the night shift, but don't take it out on the customers.  The only reason I give this place 2 stars instead of 1 is because the food was good.  I ordered the fish and chips, which was crispy and not over-battered.  But the food did not make up for the terrible service.  Some of my friends felt so uncomfortable that they did not want to order anything.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I will not be going to this place again.

Expertly crafted late night and midnight menus still available!

One bartender is great, female, there is a bartender graveyard who cussed me out because I called him out in his rudeness. I even complained to management the following day. I still will frequent this joint because of their amazing 24hour deals.

Although I miss Ashley tremendously she was our server for more than 5 years. My family and I frequent Shucks at least once a week for either dinner or breakfast and the food is always excellent. I would highly recommend this establishment for dinning.

For years I have driven past Shuck's and wondered just what was going on inside the place.  From the outside it is certainly a curious structure with an almost abusive amount of signage and a corrugated metal sort of look.  You really don't even know what to expect inside.  Answer is, you shouldn't expect much.  On top of sporting the same decoration as likely slapped on in the early 1980s, this place is a Dallas Cowboys-devoted sports bar.  For some of us, that will hurt your appetite.  

So why did I only ding the rating one star for such an assault on a girl via ambiance?  Shuck's food is is really disturbingly good.  We were guessing it would either be super sketchy or really good.  Thank god it was the latter.  Their menu is a curious collection of laminated pages and their claim of oysters just lists them in quantity, not type.  No one should come in expecting a raw bar experience.

You should expect really good oyster shooters and lots of them.  There are three types, of which we chose the Barracho, essentially a traditional tequila shot complete with salt and lime.  Added to the happy hour order ($5) of peel-and-eat shrimp (NOTE: they give you a spot of very nice horseradish which was excellent and unexpected), this makes for an excellent start.  Also, the martinis are half price during happy hour and without a doubt it was one of the best shaken martinis i have had in recent memory.  I am often disappointed.

Our server was quick and on top of our table with the perfect combination of food/drink delivery, plate swipes and privacy.  It was impressive.

Lastly, our food could not have been better.  The cheeseburger was perfection.  The right amount of bun softness and practically perfect ratio of melted cheese to meat patty with right amount of doneness.  The thin-cut French fries were straight out of the handbook of how to make perfectly cooked potatoes. And my steak was done precisely to my order.  You would think this would be easy, but to get differing meats done correctly and delivered on time seems to be a problem for most places.  Shuck's nailed it.

I'm almost scared to go back.  Have you ever gone to a place and had such a good experience that you think it has to be a complete mistake?  However, the more I think about those tequila oyster shooters, the more I think I will be back sooner than later.
This place wasn't bad at all, I just wish they had menu options that weren't sea food. Maybe some appetizers or something. The items are really limited if your like me and don't eat she'll fish

We have been here a few times, and the place has never let us down! Whether we have the crabs, a sandwich, or pasta, it has been delicious. We get the oysters On the Half-Shell every time we go! Good service, and decent prices
Always come here for late bite.  Service is super friendly all the time and foods great at a good price.

By far the best oysters ever.  They have great food and great dills.  The customer service is amazing and I would and have gone back plenty of times.  If your in the mood for a good sandwich or great oysters please visit this place.  It's a neighborhood place but so worth the visit.

Just not really my thing personally. 

Service is good, food is OK but nothing stellar. Price is about right. Came here a second time for their lamb but it tasted so-so this second go-around. 

The crab is alright, my sister-in-law seemed to enjoy it. 

The lunch size pastas is probably your best bet in terms of banging for your buck. Other than that, the fried shrimp platter -- not so much. Buffalo wings weren't bad, and neither is the tuna tartare...

Best part? Dessert.  Cookies and cream sandwich, Key lime pie, or the cheesecake eggroll.

I would come here again if I was asked to, but I don't think I'll ever be on the hunt for it. Again, just not my thing.

Great place to meet friends, have a conversation and enjoy a great meal.  We had a top notch dinner that would've been 3 times the price on the Strip.  I had the jambalaya pasta and carrot cake...delicious.  It's an oyster place (with smokin' horseradish sauce) and very fresh oysters) but wish there was fresh fish on the menu too.  Great choice for us...we'll be back.  (Restroom was clean and the health dept gives them an "A" with zero demerits.)
Great bar, food is amazing for a seafood specialty bar. Pricing is great and their breakfast food / late night menu is great!!!
Good crab legs and fried shrimp! Didn't like the cole slaw, but over all I will be returning l!

We've returned here for a good fish dinner many times, and we've never been disappointed.  I am a HUGE fan of their lobster sticks.  OMGawd, so tasy and perfectly cooked.  We also had the coconut shrimp skewers and calamari.  Equally delish!   The ambience is just perfect, no need to dress up or feel under dressed.  There is plenty of parking and always get seated right away.  On Tuesday nights, they have some sort of Painting Class on one half of the restaurant, which is a big draw for the ladies.  I've experienced this paint class thing at other restaurants, so it must be a trend.
All around good seafood well most times. Had a pound of crab but it was bits and pieces not happy tonight.

I will NEVER eat at Shucks again!

Arrived on a Saturday evening and took a seat at the side bar.

After being ignored or should I say not noticed for about ten minutes the bartender comes over and asked if I would like something to drink. I order a drink and take a look at the menu. I order my dinner, after the bartender takes my order she comes right back to verify she had it correct before it was entered into the computer. On one hand I appreciate that she wanted to input it correctly, but maybe she should have written it down. 

When my dinner is delivered it is delivered by someone from the kitchen who just puts a plate of food in front of me. No regard to if I would like anything else or if everything looks ok. The food was so, so. I had much better in the past. One step above Red Lobster.

After I finish, another fifteen minutes go by and I'm sitting with an empty plate and waiting for my check. My plate is removed and another ten minutes goes by before I'm given my check. Once my check arrives I pay in cash and have to wait another ten minutes before my change is returned. I was beginning to wonder if the bartender was going to assume that my change was a tip and never return it to me the customer. 

What upsets me the most is all the time I'm sitting at the bar area in front of the walk way in and out of the kitchen. People are constantly walking back and forth with no regard or level of service to their customers. From what I could observe, one bartender was on duty to service the entire main bar and side bar area alone. One wait person to service the restaurant and seating area solo again. One mediocre manager on duty who spent more time talking to a female customer than managing the operation. This so called manager did no managing, the tables are dirty, your customers are not being serviced in a timely manner. What do  you do other than flirt with female customers?

Their business must be suffering and trying to save money on payroll by understaffing the entire restaurant.  Your not saving money if your not servicing your customer properly and upsetting them to the point of not returning. 

Obviously, the only thing keeping this bar alive is the revenue from the video poker machines not the food or service.

Love this place.  Been eating here since 2010 but haven't been in about a year.  No special reason, just been busy.  Stopped by today on a whim and picked up seared tuna, crab stuffed tilapia, shrimp and rice and some raw oysters.

Wow, it was great.  All of it.  Especially the oysters, big and meaty.  Won't be a year before we go back! Thanks Shucks, good job.

We were craving for oysters and wanted to try them out at shucks. Not the kind of seafood restaurant I was looking for, but we still give it a shot. The place is kinda old and smell like rotten towel. The server was nice and friendly though. We went on a Sat and they were having a Sat deal on the clam bake for 21.95 (original price is 26.95). We also ordered a dozen of oysters and they were just okay.  The clam was huge, had at least 20 clams, 5 crab legs, spicy sausages, corn, and potatoes.  They were delicious, especially the clams. The clams were so juicy and meaty. We could hardly finish all the seafood they packed into the bowl. We left most of the potatoes and corn untouched. If we knew the clam bake is that big, we probably would not have ordered the oysters.

Good service Mickey and Larry are two of the best bartenders/servers in Las Vegas! If you like good seafood I recomend this place over Joe's Crab Shack anyday. Their fresh shrimp appetizers and sauce rule and the mahi mahi tacos are real delicious. Keep in mind they can blacken any food you like. I have literally seen people partyin and having a good time here then eat some nachos then fall into a food coma right after they finished their beer and meal. I travel for a living and this place is right off the freeway on my way home from McCarran Airport and it is the place I always stop for a good meal. Also like to mention a very mix class of people that go here. I have seen retired couples to biker groups and night club promoters at this place. It's nice check it out.

Been here a few times. We like tavern-like atmosphere and the bar area is pretty cool. Very good service tonight. We had the crab cake app and they seem like the frozen ones u can buy at the store, but they were fried nicely. Presentation was very nice. The crab cake sauce and the cole slaw were really good. I ordered a 1/2 dozen of raw oysters and had to ask for saltines because they had a strong, fishy taste. Tried them with the crackers but they were still way too fishy to enjoy. Like 'bad seafood' fishy. Tried my best but couldn't finish them. Got a little nervous. I've had my fair share of oysters for almost 30 years in Louisiana and I've never had a strong, 'not good' fishy flavor experience like that. I was let down. It could possibly be that they were frozen when they weren't fresh and defrosted, or the fact that they just might not have been fresh tonight. Not sure. Might have been an off night or just a fluke thing. Hubby had the fried shrimp basket with fries. The shrimp were ok. I guess we're spoiled with good gulf shrimp and authentic fried seafood platters. The french fries and cocktail sauce were really good. 

Going back to the other times we went.. 
The first time, I had the gumbo. It wasn't authentic or tasty and I didn't finish that either. Took a few bites and was done. It might be good to someone who hasn't had La. gumbo before or someone who likes the boxed/bagged gumbo mix flavor, but it's not for me. The second time we went, I had the fried oyster poboy and it was good. The poboy bread was nice from what I can remember. I'm pretty sure it was on french bread. I just remember liking it. Hubby had the shucks burger and he enjoyed it. It was filling and tasty. 

We'll probably be back for the atmosphere, drinks and maybe I'll try the Oysters Rockefeller or the baked New Orleans oysters. Might also try something recommended on Yelp. Won't have the jambalaya because we're used to authentic cajun jambalaya and authentic creole jambalaya.. but to some it might be really good. Overall, not bad. Just have to figure out what floats your boat at a place like this.

A trip back in time for me.  Nearly 10 years to the day my friend and I are back at Shucks.  We used to live up the street and this was our goto spot for some VP, beer and food.  Is it me or is this place now smoke-free?  If that is the case...THANK YOU !

I had the Mahi Mahi tacos and they were outstanding!  There must have been half a pound of mahi mahi in those two tacos...OK I'm likely exaggerating and clearly didn't have a scale with me but those things were stuffed full of nice quality fish. I'd venture back up here just for those tacos. Bar service was a little slow but once things got rolling with the food and the comp'd beers they had it all dialed in. Glad to see you guys are still around...keep up the good work and quality food.

FUN SPOT!!!
Met some friends after work, and we had pretty good apps and food.
I could totally see going here and just having fresh seafood apps - Oysters, Crab Cocktail, peel & eat shrimp. MMMMMMMM

We did have a plate of oysters, and they were fresh and yummy. Also ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp. They were good, a TINY bit on the dry side. Fried Calamari was OK. The steamed garlic muscles were great, whish it had come with some toast points for the broth.

On the night we went, it was $3 taco night. I ordered 3 tacos. They were completely fine, definitely not amazing. My friends ordered pasta dishes (Vodka Scallops and Shrimp Scampi) and really liked them!

I discovered that Friday is $5 app night! I think next time I am going to hit it and just stick to the apps and fresh seafood. That seems to be the key here.

BUT- Saturdays is 2-for-$20 Pasta Night, so you may be inspired to go try the pastas that my friends loved!

Either way, the room is fun and rustic, the staff was super friendly, and we had a blast socializing! Just wish the food was a bit better.

We were on vacation in New Orleans in November and this place has a very large and very varied menu including many of the things we had in The Big Easy.  We started with Orleans Style Oysters baked with garlic butter and parmesan cheese and they were almost as good as the ones we had in New Orleans.  Then my husband had New England clam chowder in a bread bowl while I just had a cup of soup.  It was very tasty but could have had a little more clams.  Then we shared linguini and clams in a white wine sauce which they split for us and each of our portions was tremendous.  My husband really enjoyed it as I did but I thought the pasta was a little to soft (I like my pasta al dente).

Will definitely be back here as I would like to try something from the Bucket List

I love this place...even knowing that they're a Dallas Cowboys bar.

Their food is amazing, their prices are more than reasonable, their drinks are fresh and tasty and I've never had bad service from their staff.  I highly recommend this place as a seafood dive with a great bar and sports atmosphere.

Still so good, we ate there twice in three days. Lobster roll with lots of lobster salad - light, not gooey - with a little lettuce on a great sub roll. Tater tots and garlic fries (ask for them; I didn't see them listed on the menu). Oysters rockefeller which all oyster lovers will appreciate. Snow crab sold by weight. Delicious seafood pasta. We could not have been happier!

Food is awesome. 
We had the crab legs, ginger scallops and the crab spinach dip (mediocre) 

The late night bar tender was horrible. Inattentive, slow, unhelpful.

We went in and he was less than inviting. But I was stuck on getting my grub on. 

We spent about 2 hours or more at this location and I was able to get a complete observation of this bartender and the impact he's having on late night business. You should really consider hiring someone with more personality! It will go a long way! 

Also, I may be a little bias because we have our spots and they take care of us, but after 6 drinks and 2 shots you would think two good looking females could get SOMETHING comped. Like maybe a bottle of water? But he charged us for that too. I mean, I get it, we pay for what we order, but we had to order the water twice. So there's that. I don't care how that sounds.

Bottom line you need a friendly bartender because this guy is bad for business. He didn't chat to any of the customers, he left our food in front of us for a half hour after we were finished. He didn't ask us if we wanted refills. 

Nexxxxxxt bar!!!

I loved coming to shucks. Their food is amazing and drinks are strong. Well my friend and I spent three hours at Shucks eating and drinking. Had a great time the service was on point, our waiter was personable and funny,we had no problems. Well we went to go get our nails done and get boba. Before we left the plaza we thought well let's get our family some food to go, since the food was really good. We walked in and sat at the bar to get a quick to go order. We were handed a menu and told the server would be right with us. Then we waited and waited as a group of servers and management ignored us. No server ever came. Well as we were ready to storm out, pissed off from being ignored by the bar staff, victor came and saved the day. He took our order and apologized for the other staff. Who by the way were still ignoring us and walking by with out checking on us. I don't know if the staff was upset  because we had outside boba drinks with us or what. But being treated like second class citizens is not my thing. Victor the server is amazing and the only reason we stayed and placed a second order. But everyone else well they were jerks the second time around. I'll never  go back to Shucks or recommend this restaurant. And yes I got loud and made super snide comments and was still ignored. Bye forever lobster bites. Visit date 7/22/2016

The atmosphere is decent: however, everywhere you sit you can see right in to the kitchen.  The food portions were a good size and the food temperature was hot.  The taste was average.  The service was good and accommodating.

Service was excellent!!.  Oysters, not so.

We went there for oysters (table for 10).  One of my friends said they should drop the "h" out of their name.  The oyster's had zero "oyster liquor" in them.  Usaully a sign of not so fresh oysters.  They didn't have a "mignonette" sauce for the oysters or even know what it was when asked.  Other food was good to most of our party.  Below is a link to a simple mignotte recipe.

http://www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/Mignonette-Sauce-15405

Didn't go for their beer and didn't go for their oysters. 

After some strenuous exercise at the climbing gym, a few of us were hungry. But we're poor so we needed something cheap. And then my friend suggested Taco Tuesdays at Shucks! 

The place is pretty large with ample seating. It was pretty empty on a Tuesday night. Eerily quiet. We took our seats at a large table. Our server was quick to take our orders. 

A plate of two tacos usually run around $10. But each taco was $3 in which you can choose from shrimp, grilled mahi-mahi or your regular fried fish. We each got two tacos - the mahi-mahi and the regular fish taco. Food came out pretty quick. The tacos were pretty big, I thought they were going to be a lot smaller like the usual authentic 3-bite tacos. The plate also came with colorful chips and yummy salsa. Both tacos definitely hit the spot. Wasn't greasy or too heavy. 

I had to flag down our server for some more salsa and a refill for water. I was a tad disappointed because the place was so empty and I shouldn't be playing find-our-waiter when we were the only customers there. 

I took a peek at the rest of the menu. It seems a little bit on the pricey side. Maybe I'll come back next time to try their oysters. But for what they're charging, they better be amazing!

This place is right next to my house. And I decided to try them. 
Pros: The service was good. They were willing to make me the drink off the menu, food was served fast. 
Cons: 
The raw oyster was not fresh at all, they smelled really bad and tasted fishy. This is kinda disappointing for a oyster bar. 
And Therefore, their oyster shooter wasn't good. 
The next thing we ordered was steamed clams. And again, they weren't great. I've had clams from different places and none of them were that fishy. 
For all reason above, I wouldn't recommend Shuck to nobody.
Great friendly staff. The crowd feels very neighbohood, as if they all know each other. Everyone is very welcoming and chatty. Not sure about the food, but bar atmosphere is great.
I love the food not only that, great service, and the bartender Sean dose a really great job, I do like that you have to buzz in after hours. Plus it is open 247.

I must say I was rather impressed. I talked this place up to a couple of co-workers and they were not disappointed at all. The breakfast specials are great on the wallet and good for the belly. Great eats at a great price. The service was top notch and the food was out in a flash. I got the chicken fried steak, complete with eggs, potatoes and just enough gravy. They've extended the time of their breakfast special, so you've got plenty of time to get there and enjoy. I will definitely return.  It's time for libations and oysters.

I'm updating this review because as of recent and since the general manager reached out I have received great service once again. 

Like I said my boyfriend and I come here a lot and I was super let down after an employee refused me the night's special because he was busy (there was one other person sitting at the bar) however, oscar, nick, anthony, and karina have always given good service and still continue to do so. 

It's refreshing to see them any time we come in. 
Thank you for reaching out!

Really good place to enjoy some good eats that won't break the bank.  We got the Mother Shucker and it was freakin huge!!  The burger was a full pound stuffed with cheese,bacon, and mushroom.      Alps I on tap were the garlic ginger scallops that my wife said were tasty!  Our total bill for this feast was only $32.  Definitely will be back.
I ordered 1/2 lb of Crablegs with a bowl of clam chowder with calamari for an appetizer...and the food was awesome!  I should have came here a long time ago!

I am a local that works in the Vegas industry.  I come here after work to have oysters and great drinks with Larry (the best bartender).  He takes care of my friends and I all the time!  If you want great food and great service with awesome drinks, come see Larry!  Graveyard shift!  Oh ya baby!

I stopped in around 11 pm on a Saturday for a bite to eat. I didn't realize that you had to be buzzed in. That's a bit creepy. Once inside I found the place dead with a cluster of waitresses and bartenders huddled off to the side joking around.

 I took a seat at the bar. After a few minutes the bartender tore herself away from her personal conversation to wait on me.  Even after that, the service was slow. The bartender seems miserable to there. She was equally as morose with the few other bar patrons. After going over the menu I asked her opinion on some choices I had narrowed down. Her menu knowledge left much to be desired. I settled on the oysters. They are terribly small and poorly shucked. 

The reason I have this place 2 stars instead of 1 is because it has potential but like many other Yelpers have stated, the service needs improved.

As a sports bar or a seafood joint, I'll admit Shucks is on the average side.

The only reason my family and I go here is for the breakfast deals (served until 1pm most days). You can truly high quality bar-food breakfasts here for $5. Pancakes, potatoes, chicken fried steak, benedicts...all really good. You will spend more on half the amount of food at any fast food chain.

I have older in-laws who wouldn't otherwise step foot in a bar, but love Shucks, and at the low price, you can take a bunch of folks out without breaking the bank and enjoy the Sunday morning NFL game while you munch away your hangover.

took my mom to dinner, she wanted cab legs. have not been here in about 3 years.
I forgot how small the menu was, the portions were tiny, granted we ended up getting 2 appetizers; spinach & crab dip (no crab I could see or taste!) and stuffed shrimp (4) smallish shrimp stuffed with seasoned bread crumbs(and again not a hint of crab that I could discern). There also was a misunderstanding regarding a order of guacamole, for $ 2.95 I expected chips, not a side serving which was a good size. I was told by the waiter that people order it to add to their sandwiches, it was a lot of guac for that. the chips he brought were another $ 2.95 which I was surprised to see on the bill. I used to come here 4-5 times a year when I lived near by and was always satisfied but since moving back in the area, this was a huge disappointment. Small menu, small portions (except the guac!) bland taste very poor value. I hope this was just an off night for Shucks. (I did mention to the waiter about the guac and chips, I did tell him in the end not to worry but he was not very forth coming or apologetic a good waiter would gotten a manager or taken the chips off the bill, I deal with the public in the hotel industry and some thing of this nature would have been done regardless of my wishes).
Decent food with a fair price, nice and roomy inside the tavern

First off, the food is amazing and fresh.. Me being a seafood lover, almost everything on the menu is great!... But that's not even the half of it. I've come here a few times and always loved it; but tonight was THE WORST Customer Service I have ever had in my entire life. The Blonde female bartender was nice and personable. The male brunette older, grumpy heavy-set bartender, Sean, had no personality what-so-ever and came to check on us only to reply in an irritated tone. HE NEEDS TO BE FIRED ASAP! This is not a joke. He decided to scam our bill, as to hope we didn't notice, and charge us for extra drinks as we were already actively playing the machines. We decided to tell the gentleman the problem and he insisted he was right in his actions. Now me, being in the food and beverage industry, instantly noticed his lack of motivation and enthusiasm already, as he watched sports, but still gave him the benefit of the doubt... At first. As we argued about the bill he got very offensive and unprofessional yelling inside the restaurant trying to force us to leave. I will NEVER come back to this restaurant again because of the most terrible service I've ever had in my life. Do Not Come Here! SEAN IS THE RUDEST BARTENDER AND WILL GET IN YOUR FACE TO PROVE A POINT.... TO A CUSTOMER. Beware

Not very impressed. Had a clam bake, it was over cooked and not well seasoned. Soup was bad/too watery or salty. Calamari was over cooked. Oysters were ok, but that is hard to mess up. The server was nice, but the food needs some serious work.

Every month I get a ravenous craving for fish, especially oysters!!! My boyfriend and I were originally headed to the oyster bar inside palace station, but the wait was easily 2 hours... minimum! I certainly had no time for that, especially with my mood swings, so we decided to head to shucks.
